law.catch_line: Requirements of procuring agency for selection committee.

text.section: Before a person joins a selection committee, he shall receive an orientation from the procuring agency whose secretary appointed members to the committee. The orientation shall include, but not be limited to, an explanation of all statutes and administrative regulations pertaining to the person's service on the selection committee.
For administrative purposes, a selection committee shall be attached to the procuring agency whose secretary appointed members to the committee.

A procuring agency shall provide a selection committee with:
Suitable quarters in Frankfort, Kentucky, in which to conduct its business;
An executive secretary and any other staff support necessary for the expeditious conduct of a selection committee's duties and responsibilities; and
Office supplies.

law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 55, sec. 4, effective July 14, 1992.
